column2: The evidence of a  virtual complainant need not be corroborated by
the  evidence  of  the  decoy  as  per  the  judgments  of  Gunasekera  v  The

column1: Attorney General 79(1)  N.L.R. 348 and Sunil v Attorney General(1999) 3 Sri

column2: L.R. 191. However, Gunasekera v The Attorney General, the then Supreme
uncorroborated  testimony of a  complainant provided  that the trial  Court
found it to be "cogent and convincing".
